data.text:
On Zayin Adar I 5749, the levaya of the Rebbe’s brother-in-law, R’ Shemaryahu Gurary, known to all by his acronym Rashag, we are republishing a gallery from Rebbedrive of his levaya in which the Rebbe attended • Full Article, Photos

Rabbi Shmaryahu Gurary, known to all by his acronym Rashag, was the Frierdiker Rebbe’s eldest son-in-law and chairman of the Tomchei Tmimim Yeshivos, but after the Rebbe was chosen to succeed, he stood behind him and steadfastly supported his every move, even when it called for great sacrifices • Presented in honor of the Yahrtzeit of the Rashag on Vov Adar • By Beis Moshiach Magazine • Full Article

During a late night pizza party for IDF soldiers during a solidarity trip to Israel by Chabad Lubavitch of Southwest Florida, led to a total of 10 daily tefillin commitments • Full Story, Photos, Video

Over the past 1.5 years, under the direction of Machon ‘Taharas Habayis’, an esteemed select group of energetic Mashpiim, young Mechanchim and outstanding Yungelait have been undergoing a rigorous and intense series of Shiurim, lectures, and training in all areas pertaining to building a “Bayis Neeman B’yisroel” • Full Article

Hundreds joined the levaya of Mussie Sputz, the 22-year-old daughter of R’ Dovid and Eidle Sputz of Crown Heights, as it passed by 770 on its way to Old Montefiore Cemetery for burial • Photos

In an exciting development for the vibrant Jewish community, the Shechuna app has officially launched! Designed to seamlessly connect both residents and visitors with the spiritual and communal resources of Crown Heights, Shechuna promises to be a game-changer in navigating the neighborhood • Full Story

An IDF soldier was killed and eight people were injured a little after 9 a.m. on Wednesday after Hezbollah launched a heavy barrage of rockets at northern Israel and several rockets fell in and near Tzfas. There were direct rocket hits in the industrial area of southern Tzfas as well as on the IDF base in the northern part of the city • Full Story, Video

Learn the fascinating ancient Jewish laws around debt collection and loans from this in-depth analysis with Rabbi Heschel Greenberg. Discover the biblical origins of allowing 30 days before collecting debts. Hear how sabbatical year laws compare to these debt rules. Find out how oral contracts and written contracts impacted repayment. Understand why guarantors also had to wait 30 days to repay loans. Get insight into stipulations and conditions around these historic religious lending practices • Watch

The joyous month of Adar has this year been doubled, and so is the excitement and festivities! Friday morning – Rosh Chodesh Adar… all boys were greeted and swept into dancing circles. This was just the beginning! Talmidim eagerly awaiting the “Chinezishe Letzitatzye” the event ushering in Adar, while concluding the Chodesh Shvat Mivtza ‘Basi L’gani’ • Full Story, Photos
